author: Kolkata Bureau
text:
Targeting West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee for her remarks on the Narada News sting operation, the Communist Party of India (Marxist) on Thursday asked whether she was an expert on video footage.

“She has claimed that the footage is doctored. When did she become an expert on the matter? The Centre is also silent on the issue. I wonder why the State government is not verifying the authenticity of the footage. The verification can be done by the computer science department of any university,” CPI(M) Polit Bureau member Mohd. Salim said.

He said that instead of ascertaining the authenticity of the tapes, Ms. Banerjee was accusing the man behind the sting.

“She and her party are opposing any kind of probe. It is evident that she wants to cover it up and would persecute whoever wants to bring out the truth,” Mr. Salim added.

The CPI(M) leader also targeted the Bharatiya Janata Party.

“Why isn’t the BJP acting in this matter? They are indulging in theatrics but doing nothing. In Parliament, we all saw how [Finance Minister] Arun Jaitley kept mum when the matter was raised,” he said.
title: CPI(M) accuses Mamata of cover-up
